intro: Limnorchis convallariifolia, commonly known as the marsh helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. This plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows. It thrives in temperate climates and is often associated with calcareous soils. Limnorchis convallariifolia is known for its ability to form dense colonies, contributing to the ecological structure of its habitat.
